results.title: Psychological Continuum of Elderly Patients Suffering from Arterial Hypertension with Metabolic Syndrome, Against the Background of Chronotherapy with a Fixed Combination of Amlodipine, Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin.
results.text_hl: Psychological Continuum of Elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ Suffering from @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@Arterial Hypertension@@@ with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@Metabolic Syndrome@@@, Against the Background of Chronotherapy with a Fixed Combination of @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@Rosuvastatin@@@.

results.title: A Case of Aquagenic Syringeal Acrokeratoderma in a Male Patient Undergoing Treatment With an Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@'s medical history was unremarkable, except for the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ for @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ for performance @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@.

citations.NLM: Lindsay J, Incristi AR, Arnett B, Costa M, Chong C. A Case of Aquagenic Syringeal Acrokeratoderma in a Male Patient Undergoing Treatment With an Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor. Cureus. 2024 Nov;16(11):e74157. PMID: 39712798

results.title: Lisinopril reverses behavioural alterations in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: We conclude that @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ normalized the increase in SBP and partly reversed the alterations of @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@-like behaviour in SHR.

citations.NLM: Repova K, Aziriova S, Kovacova D, Trubacova S, Baka T, Kanska R, Barta A, Stanko P, Zorad S, Molcan L, Adamcova M, Paulis L, Simko F. Lisinopril reverses behavioural alterations in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Gen Physiol Biophys. 2019 May;38(3):265-270. PMID: 31184313

results.title: Apparent lisinopril overdose requiring hemodialysis.
results.text_hl: SUMMARY: A 51-year-old white man (weight, 85 kg; height, 178 cm; body mass index, 28) with a history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @DISEASE_Low_Back_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D017116 @@@low back pain@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@ apparently took 27 @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10-mg tablets (3.18 mg/kg body weight) over a period of 3 or fewer days.

citations.NLM: Belay TW, Nusair AR. Apparent lisinopril overdose requiring hemodialysis. Am J Health Syst Pharm. 2013 Jul 15;70(14):1226-9. PMID: 23820459
citations.BibTeX: @article{23820459, title={Apparent lisinopril overdose requiring hemodialysis.}, author={Belay TW and Nusair AR}, journal={Am J Health Syst Pharm}, volume={70}, number={14}, pages={1226-9}}
